title: ‘The next Kante? I’ve already found him’
text:
Paper Talk: Ex-Foxes scout already found the next Kante, Messi’s telephone celebration explained March 6, 2017 2:28pm by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS FORMER Leicester scout Steve Walsh claims he’s already found the next N’Golo Kante, why Lionel Messi pulled out an imaginary telephone after scoring, and Sergio Ramos rubbishes Cristiano Ronaldo claims. 
All that and more in Monday Paper Talk! 
‘THE NEXT KANTE? I ALREADY FOUND HIM’ 
Former Leicester scout Steve Walsh believes he’s already brought “the next Kante” to Everton. 
Walsh recruited French midfielder N’Golo Kante for the Foxes from Caen for a reported €8 million fee before last season, and the 25-year-old was instrumental in the club’s surprise Premier League triumph. 
While Kante will likely earn a second successive winners’ medal after transferring to Chelsea last summer, Walsh moved to the Toffees and recruited Idrissa Gueye from Aston Villa before Socceroo Mile Jedinak arrived at Villa from Crystal Palace. 
During 2016, the 27-year-old midfielder made 176 tackles compared to Kante’s 157, according to Metro. 
“The next Kante? ‘I’ve already found him,’ chortles Walsh, half-serious,” Walsh told The Times in an interview. Idrissa Gueye of Everton (C) celebrates scoring against Sunderland. Source: Getty Images 
“He is talking about Idrissa ‘Gana’ Gueye. Walsh had earmarked Gana to replace Kante at Leicester, having scouted him extensively when he played for Aston Villa, and Gana’s £7m signing typifies Walsh’s knack of seeing value by looking beyond a player’s surrounds.” 
Gueye has been displaying Kante-like traits in his defensive midfield role, and recently scored his first Everton goal in a recent man-of-the-match performance against Sunderland. 
Luckily for the Toffees, Walsh’s decision to recruit Gueye wasn’t talked down by Ronald Koeman like Claudio Ranieri tried to with Kante. 
Walsh told The Times that Ranieri was “sceptical” about signing Kante as he didn’t think he was “big enough”. However, Walsh said he was eventually able to wear the Italian down. Chelsea's French midfielder N'Golo Kante. Source: AFP 
EXPLAINED: LEO MESSI’S PHONE CALL CELEBRATION 
Lionel Messi was in sparkling form with two goals and two assists for Barcelona in a 5-0 rout of Celta Vigo, but what was this celebration all about? 
After scoring a superb solo goal, he hugged teammates before pulling out an imaginary telephone. Barcelona's Argentinian forward Lionel Messi (R) after scoring a goal. Source: AFP 
Rumours on social media went into overdrive and suggested Messi was appealing for a transfer to another club or a replacement for departing manager Luis Enrique, but Barca officials explained to Spanish media that the superstar was gesturing to his nephew in the crowd. 
Messi’s brother Rodrigo had been trying to call the Argentine in the days leading up to the game, but never got to speak with him. 
Messi sought to make up for the lack of communication by dedicating the imaginary phone call to his family, who were watching the game at the Nou Camp. 
Rodrigo’s caption for his Instagram post was, “Simply a great” with two clapping emojis. A post shared by Rodrigo (@rodrigo.messi10) on Mar 4, 2017 at 4:59pm PST Barca dominate Celta Vigo 1:34 
RAMOS HITS BACK AT RONALDO CLAIMS 
The race for the La Liga title is shaping up as the tightest in Europe’s top five leagues, so it’s no surprise the tension may be high in the Barcelona and Real Madrid camps. 
Last week Spanish TV show “Jugones” claimed Sergio Ramos had fallen out with Isco and Alvaro Morata during a team meeting, and that he had said superstar Cristiano Ronaldo didn’t need to work as hard as others. 
Following Madrid’s 4-0 win over Eibar, Ramos told the media: “It is not true. You have to inform yourselves, look at the evidence and tell the truth.” 
“We got together at half-time against Las Palmas, what we talked about did not leave there and I am glad of that. 
“The other day I did not say Cristiano does not have to run, we all run here. We are all equals and the key is in our competitiveness.” Ronaldo-less Real cruise 1:30 
IT’S TRUE: UNITED BARELY EVER CONCEDE PENALTIES AT HOME 
Manchester United fans were shocked when referee Kevin Friend gave Bournemouth a penalty after Phil Jones brought down Marc Pugh. 
According to this statistic, they had good reason to be. 
In 476 Premier League games played at Old Trafford, it was just the 24th spot kick awarded to the opposition, and the 17th that was converted. 
That means United concede a penalty every 19.8 games at home, which is more or less than one every season. Dramatic day at Old Trafford 0:51 
Joshua King’s strike was the second given at Old Trafford this season after James Milner’s in January. 
United lead the top six Premier League teams for the least penalties conceded at home ahead of Chelsea (26), Manchester City (29), Liverpool (37), Arsenal (37) and Tottenham (42). 
Meanwhile, Sir Alex Ferguson’s favourite red wine is now available to Red Devils supporters at home matches, according to The Sun. 
The 187.5ml Cabernet Sauvignon, made by club sponsors Casillero del Diablo, costs £4.80 and is being served since the Bournemouth clash. Sir Alex Ferguson. Source: Getty Images 
RONALDINHO SET FOR BARCA LEGENDS RETURN 
Ronaldinho is set to play for Barcelona once again when he faces Real Madrid in a Legends match in Lebanon next month. 
Former players from the Clasico rivals will face off in a match in Beirut on April 28, where the Brazilian will make his first appearance for the legends team since becoming a club ambassador in February. 
So far the 36-year-old is the only confirmed player so far, but the Barca Legends will face a ex-Manchester United XI on June 30 at the Nou Camp before a return fixture at Old Trafford on September 2. Ronaldinho (R) meeting children at the launch of a football academy on the southern Chinese island of Hainan. Source: AFP
